intro: Scorzonera mollis f. microcalanthia, commonly known as the small-flowered scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant features a robust root system and hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often aromatic. Its flowers are typically small and yellowish, arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
